title: 📘 Behind My Blog
paragraphs: I created this page to document each step of building the "Support My Journey" blog – a place where I share my dreams and seek kind-hearted support from the community.

From the early days of learning how to set up a blog, customising its layout, linking PayPal, and setting up the donation button... every moment was meaningful. I wanted to capture this as a personal reflection and offer it to anyone walking a similar path.
milestones: 5 July 2025 – Conceived the idea of starting a personal fundraising blog.
5 July 2025 – Created a Blogspot page for raising funds to buy gear and began searching for a suitable theme.
6 July 2025 – Chose the blog name "Support My Journey".
6 July 2025 – Designed the blog's logo and favicon using blue and white tones.
6 July 2025 – Published the first fundraising goal post (Logitech G923).
6 July 2025 – Registered for PayPal and created a donation button.
7 July 2025 – Integrated progress tracker, donation history, and transparency policy.
8 July 2025 – Bought the domain supportmyjourney.com and connected it to Blogspot. Set up DNS (Cloudflare) for both Blogspot and email.
9 July 2025 – Added multilingual support within blog posts and included Google Translate widget. Optimised for mobile use.
9 July 2025 – Continued refining the translation system within posts.
10 July 2025 – Completed the translation system and removed Google Translate due to conflicts.
10 July 2025 – Took a break... I plan to update with automatic donation tracking later.
11 July 2025 – Added language support for notification pages and About widget.
12 July 2025 – Fixed display issues for small screen devices.
13 July 2025 – Added Korean and Portuguese languages.

13 July 2025 – The site now supports 8 languages (translated using AI). As this significantly lengthened the HTML, I decided to migrate content into external JSON files (hosted on GitHub + Cloudflare Pages) for easier management.
14 July 2025 – Resolved language switcher issues by combining all into a single button with a dropdown, ensuring cleaner UI and scalability.
15 July 2025 – Optimised SEO to help more people discover the blog.
15 July 2025 – Testing auto-updating donation progress via Google Sheets. PayPal data still requires manual input for security and simplicity.

20 July 2025 – Successfully integrated auto-updating progress bar and donation history. Data is now pulled from Google Sheets and supports 8 languages. Currently using test entries (Test 1–9); real contributions will replace these soon.
footer: Thank you for visiting. I hope this small journey gives you inspiration or insight. Whether or not I reach my goals, I’m committed to making this site work well.
